>
[Noqual Shield](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1421)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 100</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** varies by shield

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

**Base Material** [Noqual](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1419)

</column>

---

Noqual shields are notoriously difficult to make, requiring high-grade materials, but they're especially effective against magic. When you have a noqual shield [Raised](/Actions.aspx?ID=98), you gain its circumstance bonus to saving throws against spells that target you (as well as AC). Additionally, while the shield is Raised, when an opponent casting a spell that targets you critically fails a spell attack roll against your AC, you can reflect the spell back toward them as a reaction. Attempt a ranged attack roll against the triggering creature using your highest proficiency with a ranged weapon. If you succeed, your opponent takes the effects of a successful spell attack roll for their own spell (or the effects of a critical success if your attack roll was a critical success).
